DOCNAME: CASE OF JAVOR AND OTHERS v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , respectively , and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are husband and wife and their son and daughter . In DATE the parents travelled to GPE on a trip organised by a travel agency . On DATE the tourist group had dinner at a restaurant where they were served poisonous sea food . As a consequence , the muscles and the nervous systems of the first and the second applicant were seriously damaged which caused PERCENT disability .
CARDINAL . In DATE the first applicant brought an action against the travel agency in the Budapest II / III ORG claiming damages . The case was then transferred to the competent ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In an interim judgment ( közbenső ítélet ) , on DATE the ORG established the travel agency ’s responsibility . After a hearing on DATE , in a partial judgment ( részítélet ) of DATE , it ordered the defendant to pay MONEY plus interest to the first applicant , but dismissed his claims for non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . In the continued proceedings , ORG held hearings on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL DATE , and CARDINAL May and DATE . The ORG stated that further hearings took place on DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court delivered a decision ordering the defendant to pay damages and an allowance to the first applicant .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG confirmed the first - instance decision . The applicant filed a petition for review on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the petition . This decision was served on DATE .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE all CARDINAL applicants brought an action in LOC against the travel agency claiming further damages . Subsequently , the case was transferred to LAW . On DATE the applicants requested in vain that their case be retransferred to ORG in order to facilitate the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The Budapest II / III District Court held hearings on DATE and DATE . On DATE it decided to transfer the case to ORG . However , the file was transferred to ORG by mistake . It therefore only reached ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared its lack of competence and transferred the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared its lack of competence and transferred the file to ORG for the appropriate delegation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appointed ORG to hear the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG established that the proceedings had been stayed since DATE because the summonses could not be served on the plaintiffs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court observed that the case had ceased to exist on DATE , ipso iure , after a stay of DATE . This decision became final on DATE .
